result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Allan Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Financial obligations imposed in Count 3 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct 2.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including an AODA assessment and shall follow through with all treatment recommendations.  

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall submit to random screens of his blood, breath or urine. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

If probation is revoked and the jail sentence is served, defendant may serve the jail sentence at a jail that is convenient to employment or residence.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. 

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia. 

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased/sold/consumed. 

Defendant shall have no contact with Randy Olson or Stephanie Mueller without written consent of the probation agent.

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Allan Schmitt in court, in custody.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Keith Allan Schmitt. Joint recommendation on Ct 2 and 4, Free to argue Ct 3.  Guilty plea entered on Ct 2, 3 and 4; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2, 3, 4 and Ct's 1, 5 and 6 are dismissed for read in.  Argument on sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Allan Schmitt appeared by video, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Keith Allan Schmitt.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Information rec'd and reading waived and not guilty pleas entered.
Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Gordon Leech in person.  Counsel's first appearance.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Atty. Leech requests to be heard on bail.  State objects to any modification of bail.  Argument by counsel.  Court denies defense motion to modify bail.  Arraignment scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. No contact with co-defendants R.O. & S.M.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Allan Schmitt in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Keith Allan Schmitt. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Argument on bond.  Court sets $1000 cash bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
